newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico stocks gains wiped out by Cemex upset.
newsitem.headline: Mexico stocks gains wiped out by Cemex upset.

text.p: Mexican stocks closed sharply lower on Friday, wiping out early gains after market heavyweight Cemex reported disappointing earnings.
"Today's case was clear, Telmex moved the market along with hopes for Cemex...then Cemex's earnings were not well received," said Diego Candano, research director at the Ixe brokerage.
The leading IPC share index ended down 40.23 points, or 0.85 percent, at 4,722.42, after reaching as high as 4,832.14 earlier.
On the broad market, sliders outnumbered gainers by 55 to 45 out of 116 stocks that traded, on moderate volume of 91.0 million shares.
Cement maker Cemex CPO shares reversed an early advance of 35 centavos (4.5 cents) to drop 1.55 pesos (20 cents) at the close to 37.80 pesos ($4.85).
Cemex posted a first-half earnings during the session that were down from year-ago figures in net and operating terms.
Telefonos de Mexico (Telmex) meanwhile cut back an early advance of 50 centavos (6 cents) to just 5 centavos (less than one cent), ending at 20.25 pesos ($2.60).
Candamo said the Mexican bourse would remain volatile during the earnings season.
"It tends to open up on favourable reaction to earnings posted the night before...and then profit-taking following those gains," he said.
For Geoffrey Dennis, emerging markets strategist at HSBC-James Capel, initial reaction to earnings had made for a rough ride, but not for any lasting fundamental setback.
"The real issue at the moment is second-quarter earnings...and it is a mixed picture. They have been a touch disappointing in places," he said.
"Nonetheless, there is a sense the economy is improving at the margin and that earnings momentum is picking up. So if there is weakness, I think investors will be prepared to buy on it," he added.
